topic: top 10 ai agents open source in 2025

output.response:
```json
{
  "page_speed": [
    "Optimize images: Compress images using tools like TinyPNG or ImageOptim to reduce file size without significant quality loss. Use modern image formats like WebP for better compression and quality.",
    "Leverage browser caching: Implement proper caching headers to instruct browsers to store static assets (CSS, JavaScript, images) locally, reducing server load and improving page load times for returning visitors.",
    "Minify CSS, JavaScript, and HTML: Remove unnecessary characters (whitespace, comments) from code to reduce file sizes. Use tools like UglifyJS or CSSNano.",
    "Reduce server response time: Investigate server-side performance bottlenecks. Consider using a Content Delivery Network (CDN) to distribute content geographically closer to users.",
    "Defer offscreen images: Implement lazy loading for images below the fold to improve initial page load time. Use the `loading="lazy"` attribute or a JavaScript library.",
    "Eliminate render-blocking resources: Prioritize critical CSS and JavaScript needed for initial rendering. Defer or asynchronously load non-critical resources.",
    "Consider using HTTP/3: HTTP/3 offers improved connection management and reduced latency compared to HTTP/2.  Check if your hosting provider supports it.",
    "Optimize database queries: Slow database queries can significantly impact page speed. Analyze and optimize queries for efficiency."
  ],
  "mobile_optimization": [
    "Ensure responsive design: Use a responsive design framework that adapts to different screen sizes and resolutions.",
    "Optimize tap targets: Make sure buttons and links are large enough and spaced adequately for easy tapping on mobile devices.",
    "Use a mobile-friendly viewport: Configure the viewport meta tag to properly scale the content to the device width. `<meta name=\"viewport\" content=\"width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0\">`",
    "Avoid intrusive interstitials: Avoid using full-screen pop-ups or interstitials that block the main content, especially on mobile devices.",
    "Test mobile usability: Use Google's Mobile-Friendly Test tool to identify and fix usability issues.",
    "Compress images for mobile: Serve smaller, optimized images specifically for mobile devices to reduce data usage and improve loading times.",
    "Prioritize above-the-fold content: Ensure that the content visible without scrolling loads quickly and is relevant to the user's intent."
  ],
  "crawlability": [
    "Create and submit an XML sitemap: An XML sitemap helps search engine crawlers discover and index all the important pages on your website. Submit it to Google Search Console and Bing Webmaster Tools.",
    "Implement a robots.txt file: Use robots.txt to block search engine crawlers from accessing unimportant pages or sections of your website, such as admin areas or duplicate content.",
    "Fix broken links: Regularly check for and fix broken internal and external links. Use tools like Screaming Frog or Ahrefs to identify broken links.",
    "Use clear and descriptive anchor text: Use relevant keywords in anchor text for internal and external links to help search engines understand the context of the linked pages.",
    "Ensure proper site architecture: Organize your website's content in a logical and hierarchical structure to make it easy for crawlers to navigate and understand.",
    "Implement canonical tags: Use canonical tags to specify the preferred version of a page when multiple URLs have similar or identical content. `<link rel=\"canonical\" href=\"https://www.example.com/preferred-page/\" />`"
  ],
  "indexability": [
    "Ensure pages are not blocked by robots.txt: Double-check that important pages are not accidentally blocked from crawling in the robots.txt file.",
    "Use descriptive and unique title tags: Each page should have a unique and descriptive title tag that accurately reflects the content of the page. Keep it under 60 characters.",
    "Write compelling meta descriptions: Write concise and engaging meta descriptions that summarize the page's content and encourage users to click. Keep it under 160 characters.",
    "Avoid duplicate content: Identify and address duplicate content issues by using canonical tags, 301 redirects, or noindex tags.",
    "Use noindex tag sparingly: Only use the noindex tag on pages that you don't want search engines to index, such as thank-you pages or internal search results pages. `<meta name=\"robots\" content=\"noindex\">`",
    "Ensure proper URL structure: Use clean, descriptive URLs that include relevant keywords and are easy for users and search engines to understand.",
    "Check for indexing errors in Google Search Console: Regularly monitor Google Search Console for indexing errors and address any issues promptly."
  ],
  "structured_data": [
    "Article: Use the Article schema markup to provide information about news articles, blog posts, and other types of articles.",
    "Product: Use the Product schema markup to provide information about products, including price, availability, and reviews.",
    "Recipe: Use the Recipe schema markup to provide information about recipes, including ingredients, instructions, and nutritional information.",
    "LocalBusiness: Use the LocalBusiness schema markup to provide information about local businesses, including address, phone number, and hours of operation.",
    "Organization: Use the Organization schema markup to provide information about organizations, including name, logo, and contact information.",
    "FAQPage: Use the FAQPage schema markup to identify frequently asked questions and answers on your website.",
    "HowTo: Use the HowTo schema markup to provide step-by-step instructions for completing a task.",
    "Event: Use the Event schema markup to provide information about events, including date, time, and location.",
    "Review: Use the Review schema markup to provide information about reviews of products, services, or businesses."
  ]
}
```
